snippet: As more middle-class Indians are able to afford costlier products, they drive the demand for organic, fair-trade and artisanal items.
abstract: Increasing demand for organic, fair-trade and artisanal items among middle-class Indians is fueling growing industry of upscale dairy farms that promise better, safer milk; India’s dairy industry has only recently started buying into belief that happier cows breed healthier milk, and potentially bigger profit, even as animal has long been revered in country.
lead_paragraph: As more middle-class Indians are able to afford costlier products, they drive the demand for organic, fair-trade and artisanal items.

headline.main: Upscale Dairies Grow in India, Promising Safer Milk
headline.print_headline: Upscale Dairies Grow in India, Promising Safer Milk
